Read a sequence index

Source: R/read_seqs.R
read_seqs.Rd

Read ID, description and length for each sequence from common formats including FASTA, samtools/seqkit FASTA index files, and GFF3. Default columns are "seq_id", "seq_desc" and "length".

read_seqs(files, format = NULL, .id = "file_id", ...)

read_seq_len(
  file,
  col_names = def_names("seq_len"),
  col_types = def_types("seq_len"),
  ...
)

read_fai(file, col_names = def_names("fai"), col_types = def_types("fai"), ...)

Arguments

file

fasta or .fai/.seqkit.fai fasta index

Value

gggenomes-compatible seqs tibble

Examples

# from a fasta file
read_seqs(ex("emales/emales.fna"))

#> Reading as seq_len:
#> * emales [/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/gggenomes/extdata/emales/emales.fna]
#> # A tibble: 0 x 1
#> # … with 1 variable: file_id <chr>
# from samtools/seqkit style index
read_seqs(ex("emales/emales.fna.seqkit.fai"))

#> Reading as fai:
#> * emales.fna.seqkit [/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/gggenomes/extdata/emales/emales.fna.seqkit.fai]
#> # A tibble: 6 x 4
#>   file_id          seq_id     seq_desc                                    length
#>   <chr>            <chr>      <chr>                                        <int>
#> 1 emales.fna.seqk… BVI_008A   emale_type=EMALE01 is_typespecies=FALSE ha…  26820
#> 2 emales.fna.seqk… BVI_069    emale_type=EMALE01 is_typespecies=FALSE ha…  26808
#> 3 emales.fna.seqk… Cflag_017B emale_type=EMALE01 is_typespecies=TRUE has…  21311
#> 4 emales.fna.seqk… E4-10_086  emale_type=EMALE01 is_typespecies=FALSE ha…  20642
#> 5 emales.fna.seqk… E4-10_112  emale_type=EMALE01 is_typespecies=FALSE ha…  26856
#> 6 emales.fna.seqk… RCC970_01… emale_type=EMALE01 is_typespecies=FALSE ha…  20152
# from multiple gff file
read_seqs(c(ex("emales/emales.gff"), ex("emales/emales-tirs.gff")))

#> Reading as seq_len:
#> * emales [/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/gggenomes/extdata/emales/emales.gff]
#> * emales-tirs [/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/gggenomes/extdata/emales/emales-tirs.gff]
#> # A tibble: 0 x 1
#> # … with 1 variable: file_id <chr>
